intro: Coriandrum tordylioides, commonly known as the Turkish coriander or tordylium, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes other aromatic herbs like parsley and dill. The plant features slender, branched stems and small, greenish-yellow flowers that bloom in umbels. Its leaves are finely divided and have a delicate, peppery scent. The seeds, which are harvested for culinary and medicinal use, are similar in appearance to those of regular coriander but have a distinct flavor profile.
